div.style: display: inline-block; background-color: #d9e0e7; padding: 6px; margin: 4px; border: 1px solid #8da1b4; border-radius: 5px; line-height: 60%

div.p: The official URL for this implementation guide is:
An empty Digital Adaptation Kit (DAK) Implementation Guide to be used as a starting point for publishing SMART DAK content

description.value: An empty Digital Adaptation Kit (DAK) Implementation Guide to be used as a starting point for publishing SMART DAK content

valueMarkdown.value: Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on HL7 Terminology
Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on the HL7 Extension Pack

name.value: A birth defects surveillance mobile application should be able to function as a standalone (for training purposes, small-scale surveillance or other uses) and/or contribute data to a centralized database, depending on local protocols

description.value: *Category*: System requirements – general A birth defects surveillance mobile application should be able to function as a standalone (for training purposes, small-scale surveillance or other uses) and/or contribute data to a centralized database, depending on local protocols

name.value: Accept data from multiple input methods, including paper and geocoding (GPS)

description.value: *Category*: System requirements – usability Accept data from multiple input methods, including paper and geocoding (GPS)

name.value: Access to data, data transfer and data storage are secured (encrypted)

description.value: *Category*: Security – confidentiality Access to data, data transfer and data storage are secured (encrypted)

name.value: Adhere to complex password requirements

description.value: *Category*: Security – authentication Adhere to complex password requirements

name.value: Adjust display to fit small screens (e.g. on mobile phones)

description.value: *Category*: System requirements – usability Adjust display to fit small screens (e.g. on mobile phones)

name.value: Alert user when navigating away from a form without saving

description.value: *Category*: System requirements – usability Alert user when navigating away from a form without saving

name.value: Allow adaptability to multiple operating systems (e.g. Windows, Linux, IOS, Android)

description.value: *Category*: System requirements – usability Allow adaptability to multiple operating systems (e.g. Windows, Linux, IOS, Android)

name.value: Allow admin user to request password reset

description.value: *Category*: Security – user management Allow admin user to request password reset

name.value: Allow cascading user management and assignment of roles

description.value: *Category*: Security – user management Allow cascading user management and assignment of roles

name.value: Allow for data exchange and efficient synchronization across multiple facilities and points of service when Internet is available, even when it is intermittent and slow

description.value: *Category*: System requirements – interoperability Allow for data exchange and efficient synchronization across multiple facilities and points of service when Internet is available, even when it is intermittent and slow

name.value: Allow roles to be associated with specific geographical areas and/or health-care facilities

description.value: *Category*: Security – user management Allow roles to be associated with specific geographical areas and/or health-care facilities

name.value: Allow user to change their own password

description.value: *Category*: Security – user management Allow user to change their own password

name.value: Allow user with permission to create a new user and temporary password

description.value: *Category*: Security – user management Allow user with permission to create a new user and temporary password

name.value: Anonymize data exported from the system

description.value: *Category*: Security – confidentiality Anonymize data exported from the system

name.value: Architecture of the solution is consistent with architecture of HIS

description.value: *Category*: System requirements – interoperability Architecture of the solution is consistent with architecture of HIS

name.value: Automatically log out the user after specified time of inactivity

description.value: *Category*: Security – confidentiality Automatically log out the user after specified time of inactivity

name.value: Be able to accommodate at least [x number of]a concurrent users

description.value: *Category*: System requirements – scalability Be able to accommodate at least [x number of]a concurrent users

name.value: Be able to accommodate at least [x number of]a health-care facilities

description.value: *Category*: System requirements – scalability Be able to accommodate at least [x number of]a health-care facilities

name.value: Be able to revert to the latest functional version of the solution without losing data (server backup/restore, disaster recovery plan)

description.value: *Category*: System requirements – reliability Be able to revert to the latest functional version of the solution without losing data (server backup/restore, disaster recovery plan)

name.value: Be reliable and robust (minimize the number of system crashes)

description.value: *Category*: System requirements – usability Be reliable and robust (minimize the number of system crashes)

name.value: Be user-friendly for people with low computer literacy

description.value: *Category*: System requirements – usability Be user-friendly for people with low computer literacy

name.value: Communicate with external systems through mediators

description.value: *Category*: System requirements – interoperability Communicate with external systems through mediators

name.value: Compatible with range of mobile devices, including smartphones and tablets

description.value: *Category*: System requirements – usability Compatible with range of mobile devices, including smartphones and tablets

name.value: Configure business rules in line with guidelines and standard operating procedures

description.value: *Category*: System requirements – configuration Configure business rules in line with guidelines and standard operating procedures

name.value: Configure error messages

description.value: *Category*: System requirements – configuration Configure error messages

name.value: Configure system centrally

description.value: *Category*: System requirements – configuration Configure system centrally

name.value: Configure workflows and business rules to accommodate differences between facilities

description.value: *Category*: System requirements – configuration Configure workflows and business rules to accommodate differences between facilities

name.value: Easy to learn and intuitive to enable user to navigate between pages

description.value: *Category*: System requirements – usability Easy to learn and intuitive to enable user to navigate between pages

name.value: Enable earlier versions of records to be recoverable

description.value: *Category*: System requirements – reliability Enable earlier versions of records to be recoverable

name.value: Enable system deployment in environments subject to power loss

description.value: *Category*: System requirements – reliability Enable system deployment in environments subject to power loss

name.value: Functional Requirement Categories

description.value: Value Set for Functional Requirement Categories. Autogenerated from DAK artifacts

name.value: Functional Requirement Categories

description.value: CodeSystem for Functional Requirement Categories. Autogenerated from DAK artifacts

name.value: Generate analysis of the usage of different system features and reports

description.value: *Category*: Security – audit trail and logs Generate analysis of the usage of different system features and reports

name.value: Generate IDs that are unique across different installations or sites

description.value: *Category*: System requirements – general Generate IDs that are unique across different installations or sites

name.value: Have ability to easily back up information

description.value: *Category*: System requirements – reliability Have ability to easily back up information

name.value: If possible, the system should be embedded into the maternal/neonatal information system as an additional module

description.value: *Category*: System requirements – general If possible, the system should be embedded into the maternal/neonatal information system as an additional module

name.value: Link with insurance systems to verify eligibility and submit claims

description.value: *Category*: System requirements – interoperability Link with insurance systems to verify eligibility and submit claims
Provide password-protected access for authorized users
Notify user to change password the first time they log in
Adhere to complex password requirements
Provide mechanism to securely change a user's password
Notify user of password change to their account
Reset user's password in a secure manner
Lock out user after a specified number of wrong password attempts
Notify user if their account is locked due to wrong password attempts
Require each user to authenticate by role before gaining access to the system
Log system logins and logouts
Record all authentication violations
Provide a means to ensure confidentiality and privacy of personal health information
Log all activities performed by the user, including date- and timestamp
Log access to views of individual client records
Log access to data summaries, reports, analysis and visualization features
Log exchange of data with other systems
Generate analysis of the usage of different system features and reports
Log all data and system errors
Permit independent security audits to check security compliance on a regular basis, if required by protocol
Allow user with permission to create a new user and temporary password
Support definitions of unlimited roles and assigned levels of access, viewing, entry, editing and auditing
Allow roles to be associated with specific geographical areas and/or health-care facilities
No personally identifiable information could be shared from the local device in the country to a cloud server or other servers out of the country
Allow cascading user management and assignment of roles
Allow user to change their own password
Allow admin user to request password reset
Notify user to regularly change their password
Provide a unique version number for each revision
Generate IDs that are unique across different installations or sites
Report version number when saving data to the database
Show the number of records that are not yet synchronized
Provide capacity of the solution to be linked to data visualizer tool (e.g. Pw Bi, DHIS2)
Provide capacity of the solution to extensive reporting and analytic capabilities (e.g. export CSV files/usage metrics/built-in reporting and analytics)
Provide ability for allowed users to view confidential data
Must have ability to store images and other unstructured data
Enable system deployment in environments subject to power loss
Work in environments subject to loss of connectivity
Enable earlier versions of records to be recoverable
Have ability to easily back up information
Warn user if no valid backup for more than a predefined number of days
Be able to revert to the latest functional version of the solution without losing data (server backup/restore, disaster recovery plan)
Scalable to accommodate new demands
Be able to accommodate at least [x number of]a health-care facilities
Be able to accommodate at least [x number of]a concurrent users
Anonymize data exported from the system
Be user-friendly for people with low computer literacy
Provide informative error messages and tool-tips
Alert user when navigating away from a form without saving
Support real-time data-entry validation and feedback to prevent data-entry errors from being recorded
Simplify data recording through predefined dropdown menu or searchable lists, radio buttons or checkboxes
Support multiple languages
Use industry standard user interface practices and apply them consistently throughout the system
Easy to learn and intuitive to enable user to navigate between pages
Provide guidance to users to better support clinical guidelines and best clinical practices
Be reliable and robust (minimize the number of system crashes)
Prevent remembering username and password
Adjust display to fit small screens (e.g. on mobile phones)
Allow adaptability to multiple operating systems (e.g. Windows, Linux, IOS, Android)
Compatible with range of mobile devices, including smartphones and tablets
Accept data from multiple input methods, including paper and geocoding (GPS)
Provide user guidelines and training materials to effectively use the IT solution
Provide technical documentation of the IT solution (e.g. system architecture documentation, application programming interface (API) documentation)
Configure system centrally
Configure business rules in line with guidelines and standard operating procedures
Configure error messages
Configure workflows and business rules to accommodate differences between facilities
Automatically log out the user after specified time of inactivity

Store important system documents and information such as protocols, case inclusion criteria, surveillance population and similar important facets of the system, and make them available for retrieval as needed
Provide ability to create, read, update and delete report templates to use for automated reporting
Communicate with external systems through mediators
Provide access to data through APIs
Link with insurance systems to verify eligibility and submit claims
Allow for data exchange and efficient synchronization across multiple facilities and points of service when Internet is available, even when it is intermittent and slow
Architecture of the solution is consistent with architecture of HIS

Solution should use international coding standards for data whenever possible Countries can develop their own local coding system, but WHO recommends use of ICD-10 coding system to classify congenital anomalies for international reporting and comparisons
The system should be able to integrate with other approved systems, such as electronic medical records and public health databases, to allow for seamless data sharing and analysis

A birth defects surveillance mobile application should be able to function as a standalone (for training purposes, small-scale surveillance or other uses) and/or contribute data to a centralized database, depending on local protocols
Provide encrypted communication between components
If possible, the system should be embedded into the maternal/neonatal information system as an additional module
Access to data, data transfer and data storage are secured (encrypted)

name.value: Support real-time data-entry validation and feedback to prevent data-entry errors from being recorded

description.value: *Category*: System requirements – usability Support real-time data-entry validation and feedback to prevent data-entry errors from being recorded

name.value: The birth defects surveillance system to automatically make the reports I submit available in the system's data portal, if one exists

description.value: I want Surveillance programme manager, I want: >The birth defects surveillance system to automatically make the reports I submit available in the system's data portal, if one exists so that >I do not need to send the reports each time I generate them

name.value: The birth defects surveillance system to automatically send the reports I submit, by email, to a preconfigured distribution list

description.value: I want Surveillance programme manager, I want: >The birth defects surveillance system to automatically send the reports I submit, by email, to a preconfigured distribution list so that >I do not need to send the reports each time I generate them

name.value: The birth defects surveillance system to notify the birth defects specialist that a case needs to be reviewed using an application notification, email, SMS or other method

description.value: I want Surveillance data manager, I want: >The birth defects surveillance system to notify the birth defects specialist that a case needs to be reviewed using an application notification, email, SMS or other method so that >The birth defects specialist is informed in a timely manner about cases pending their review

name.value: The birth defects surveillance system to notify the surveillance data manager that the case has been updated with the missing information, using an application notification, email, SMS or other method

description.value: I want Data collector, I want: >The birth defects surveillance system to notify the surveillance data manager that the case has been updated with the missing information, using an application notification, email, SMS or other method so that >The surveillance data manager is informed in a timely manner

name.value: The birth defects surveillance system to notify the surveillance programme manager when a report is marked as ready for their review, using an application notification, email, SMS or other method

description.value: I want Surveillance data manager, I want: >The birth defects surveillance system to notify the surveillance programme manager when a report is marked as ready for their review, using an application notification, email, SMS or other method so that >The surveillance programme manager is informed in a timely manner about report(s) pending their review

name.value: The search to match on partial information (e.g. partial birth dates)

description.value: I want Data collector, I want: >The search to match on partial information (e.g. partial birth dates) so that >I have a better chance of finding a match

name.value: The system should be able to integrate with other approved systems, such as electronic medical records and public health databases, to allow for seamless data sharing and analysis

description.value: *Category*: System requirements – interoperability The system should be able to integrate with other approved systems, such as electronic medical records and public health databases, to allow for seamless data sharing and analysis

name.value: The system to allow search parameters configuration (e.g. mandatory fields, when partial information is acceptable)

description.value: I want Data collector, I want: >The system to allow search parameters configuration (e.g. mandatory fields, when partial information is acceptable) so that >A search can be optimized without compromising confidentiality

name.value: The system to automatically calculate indicators based on preset rules

description.value: I want Surveillance data manager, I want: >The system to automatically calculate indicators based on preset rules so that >I do not have to calculate this myself

name.value: The system to delete images and videos automatically from the device, once uploaded into the birth defects surveillance system, if required by local protocols

description.value: I want Data collector, I want: >The system to delete images and videos automatically from the device, once uploaded into the birth defects surveillance system, if required by local protocols so that >I can ensure private data do not remain on my device

name.value: The system to display sufficient data to identify the case

description.value: I want Data collector, I want: >The system to display sufficient data to identify the case so that >I can check whether this is a new or existing case record and avoid duplicates

name.value: The system to require me (a user) to search to see whether the case record is already in the system before starting a new entry

description.value: I want Data collector, I want: >The system to require me (a user) to search to see whether the case record is already in the system before starting a new entry so that >I can avoid duplicates

name.value: The system to retain history of updated information on the case record (e.g. observation notes)

description.value: I want Data collector, I want: >The system to retain history of updated information on the case record (e.g. observation notes) so that >I can review past information updates

name.value: The system to return all potential matches based on search criteria

description.value: I want Data collector, I want: >The system to return all potential matches based on search criteria so that >I can find the best match

name.value: The system to support me with visually identifying a birth defect by providing information about possible defects and syndromes (including photos, descriptions and ICD codes based on the WHO QRH) when I indicate on the screen an anatomical region of the newborn

description.value: I want Data collector, I want: >The system to support me with visually identifying a birth defect by providing information about possible defects and syndromes (including photos, descriptions and ICD codes based on the WHO QRH) when I indicate on the screen an anatomical region of the newborn so that >I can better compare and identify the anomaly or syndrome

name.value: The system to support with the necessary information related to case inclusion criteria, if it is stored in the system

description.value: I want Surveillance data manager, I want: >The system to support with the necessary information related to case inclusion criteria, if it is stored in the system so that >I can review birth defects against case inclusion criteria

name.value: To approve the generated report using a digital signature or other method appropriate for the local context

description.value: I want Surveillance programme manager, I want: >To approve the generated report using a digital signature or other method appropriate for the local context so that >I can certify the report as official

name.value: To be able to attach an identifier (e.g. QR code, barcode, fingerprint, photo) to the newborn's or mother's record based on national standards consent

description.value: I want Data collector, I want: >To be able to attach an identifier (e.g. QR code, barcode, fingerprint, photo) to the newborn's or mother's record based on national standards consent so that >I have additional ways of identifying the newborn and/or mother

name.value: To be able to collect digital signatures from clients, if acceptable according to the local protocols

description.value: I want Data collector, I want: >To be able to collect digital signatures from clients, if acceptable according to the local protocols so that >I can ensure client's informed consent for data collection is easy to get and register in the birth defects surveillance system

name.value: To be able to configure report parameters when generating reports such as time range, geography and other details

description.value: I want Surveillance data manager, I want: >To be able to configure report parameters when generating reports such as time range, geography and other details so that >Appropriate reports can be generated

name.value: To be able to flag issues with a case and send that case to the data collector

description.value: I want Surveillance data manager, I want: >To be able to flag issues with a case and send that case to the data collector so that >The data collector can review, follow up and correct the case record when further information is available

name.value: To be able to flag issues with a case and send that case to the surveillance data manager for review and follow up

description.value: I want Birth defect specialist, I want: >To be able to flag issues with a case and send that case to the surveillance data manager for review and follow up so that >The surveillance data manager can add more information to the case record and send it to the data collector

name.value: to be able to retrieve client information (e.g. newborn, mother, father) from existing electronic medical records and link it to the case record

description.value: I want Data collector, I want: >to be able to retrieve client information (e.g. newborn, mother, father) from existing electronic medical records and link it to the case record so that >I can reuse existing data and avoid collecting the same data multiple times from the client

name.value: To be able to send the final determination regarding the diagnosis back to the care provider using an application notification, email, SMS or other method, if required by the local protocol

description.value: I want Surveillance data manager, I want: >To be able to send the final determination regarding the diagnosis back to the care provider using an application notification, email, SMS or other method, if required by the local protocol so that >The care provider has a final verified diagnosis to provide better care to newborn

name.value: To be able to update demographic information of newborn/mother/informant

description.value: I want Data collector, I want: >To be able to update demographic information of newborn/mother/informant so that >The most current information can be recorded

name.value: To bypass the standard flow as needed and jump between sections, except when local protocols demand consent to proceed

description.value: I want Data collector, I want: >To bypass the standard flow as needed and jump between sections, except when local protocols demand consent to proceed so that >The data can be entered in a nonlinear fashion as needed

name.value: To create a new case record with a unique ID and timestamp of record creation

description.value: I want Data collector, I want: >To create a new case record with a unique ID and timestamp of record creation so that >I can begin entering birth defects case information

name.value: To have the ability to aggregate the data by time period and surveillance population

description.value: I want Surveillance data manager, I want: >To have the ability to aggregate the data by time period and surveillance population so that >I can check the data for quality issues

name.value: To have the ability to deidentify the data and prepare the database for analysis and reporting

description.value: I want Surveillance data manager, I want: >To have the ability to deidentify the data and prepare the database for analysis and reporting so that >Sensitive personal information is not included in birth defects surveillance reports or any results from the analysis

name.value: To have the ability to make changes to the data (case records)

description.value: I want Surveillance data manager, I want: >To have the ability to make changes to the data (case records) so that >I can correct issues that I have detected

name.value: To have the ability to query the data to look for issues of data quality

description.value: I want Surveillance data manager, I want: >To have the ability to query the data to look for issues of data quality so that >I can detect problems with the data

name.value: To have the ability to see a summary of all birth defects cases captured in the health facilities participating in the surveillance system

description.value: I want Surveillance programme manager, I want: >To have the ability to see a summary of all birth defects cases captured in the health facilities participating in the surveillance system so that >I can make better decisions related to birth defect prevention for a given administrative area/region/country

name.value: To have the ability to upload images and videos of the birth defect in the birth defects surveillance application or system

description.value: I want Data collector, I want: >To have the ability to upload images and videos of the birth defect in the birth defects surveillance application or system so that >I can share them with specialists and validate if a case shall be recorded

name.value: To have the possibility to download the data to my own programme data centre

description.value: I want Surveillance programme manager, I want: >To have the possibility to download the data to my own programme data centre so that >I have a local copy of the data for anlysis and merge with other years/cohorts of data

name.value: To have the possibility to see or visualize medical data and previous measurements (log history)

description.value: I want Data collector, I want: >To have the possibility to see or visualize medical data and previous measurements (log history) so that >I can better monitor the case

name.value: To produce reports based on stored templates

description.value: I want Surveillance data manager, I want: >To produce reports based on stored templates so that >I do not need to create the reports manually for reporting purposes

name.value: To search with wildcards (using a symbol to replace one or more characters)

description.value: I want Data collector, I want: >To search with wildcards (using a symbol to replace one or more characters) so that >I can find something without knowing the exact spelling

name.value: To view a range of standardized visualizations (e.g. charts, tables, maps)

description.value: I want Surveillance programme manager, I want: >To view a range of standardized visualizations (e.g. charts, tables, maps) so that >I am able to use data, collected in the health facilities participating in the surveillance system, for service delivery and informing programmatic actions with the aim of improving the quality of care for clients

name.value: Use industry standard user interface practices and apply them consistently throughout the system

description.value: *Category*: System requirements – usability Use industry standard user interface practices and apply them consistently throughout the system

name.value: Warn user if no valid backup for more than a predefined number of days

description.value: *Category*: System requirements – reliability Warn user if no valid backup for more than a predefined number of days

name.value: Work in environments subject to loss of connectivity

description.value: *Category*: System requirements – reliability Work in environments subject to loss of connectivity
